forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day begins with a gentleness that belies the rain forecasted for later. The morning is partly sunny, yet there’s a quiet anticipation in the air, as if the clouds are gathering their thoughts. The streets are a mix of warmth and coolness, urging residents to step outside while still wrapped in a light jacket—layers will be your ally today. As the sunlight filters through, it dances upon the resilient facades of the city, yet has already started to give way to an encroaching marine layer, obscuring distant hills and softening the outlines of the Golden Gate.

As the sun inches towards its zenith, temperatures will hover around that familiar chill, particularly as the afternoon winds whisper from the south. The evening promises a shift, and by nightfall, the forecast comes into play: rain will arrive, bringing a soothing rhythm to the bustling city as it finds its way home. With an 80% chance of precipitation and a brisk breeze that flirts with the falling temperatures, it is advisable to prepare for a cozy evening indoors or, for the adventurous, a thoughtful walk under a canopy of clouds, perhaps finding refuge in a café where the aroma of roasted beans can invigorate the spirit. It is a day best spent without haste, savoring the little pleasures as the city transitions from lingering sunlight to the embrace of a rainy night.
